Description: Floor fragment of Terra Sigillata wheel-made pottery bowl with a fine glossy dark red slip. Fine light red fabric. Stamped on inside 'CAMURI' - C. Amuri.
Curator's comments: Imperial Roman red slip fine tableware sherd of Italian Terra Sigillata ware, bowl form, dated 1st c. AD. Ettlinger, E., Hedinger, B., Hoffmann, B., Kenrick, P. M., Pucci, G., Roth- Rubi, K., Schneider, G., von Schnurbein, S., Wells, C. M. & Zabehlicky- Scheffenegger, S. 1990. Conspectus formarum terrae sigillatae Italico modo confectae. Bonn: Dr. Rudolf Habelt GMBH. The stamp refers to an Arretine potter, see C.I.L. xi. 6700, 29.
Bibliographic references: Roman Pottery / Catalogue of the Roman Pottery in the British Museum (L41)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (IF.003) (Phase 3)
